content.title: Essential Enclosure Requirements for Uromastyx
content.content: Uromastyx are desert lizards that need intense heat, bright light, and room to move on the ground. A wide, front-opening enclosure with strong ventilation and a large basking platform is the foundation for long-term health.
Size needs scale with adult length. Plan larger than minimum whenever possible, especially for larger species like U. aegyptia.

content.text: Size Requirements by Adult Length:

rows: Good baseline for most common species
Large species require much more space
Plan custom builds for giant species

content.content: Minimums are for a single lizard. Housing pairs requires at least double the space and careful monitoring for aggression.
Choose an enclosure that holds heat on the basking side while allowing strong airflow. Front-opening designs reduce stress during maintenance and feeding.

content.text: Material Comparison:

rows: Best for heat retention with adjustable vents
Works well with strong overhead heat
Only for very hot rooms or as a top panel

content.content: Recommended: Front-opening PVC or glass enclosure with a vented or mesh top section to provide airflow and reduce humidity buildup.
Uromastyx are terrestrial and need a clear horizontal gradient from hot to cool. Build a basking platform with multiple levels and crevices for security.

content.text: Zone Layout Template (48x24x24 enclosure):

rows: Warm end, under heat and UVB

content.content: Keep the basking platform 10-12 inches below the heat lamps for reliable surface temperatures. Adjust height rather than switching bulbs constantly.
High heat, strong UVB, and accurate measurement tools are non-negotiable for Uromastyx.

content.text: Required Equipment:

rows: IR temp gun, probe thermometer, hygrometer

content.content: Safety note: Always use a dimmer or thermostat on heat lamps and verify basking surface temps with an infrared thermometer.

content.text: Frequent Mistakes and Solutions:

rows: Raise platform or increase heat output
Increase ventilation and keep surface substrate dry
UVB too weak or too short
Use high-output T5 HO spanning half the enclosure
Add secure crevices and a cool hide
Provide 4+ inches of packed sand or soil

content.content: Run all equipment for several days before introducing the lizard to confirm stable temperatures and lighting coverage.

rows: Basking platform is secure and stable
Surface 120-130 deg F, cool side 82-88 deg F
UVI 4.5-6 at basking, bright visible light
Stable day and night ranges before arrival
